author: serenita_io
content:
My opinion on the `produceBlockV4` options in Nico's comment https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1882#issuecomment-3798965040 .

I think #3 is the best option, keeping things similar to how they are today and the API interaction fully stateless. It comes with the downside of passing around a lot of data which is completely unnecessary in single-node `VC <-> 1BN` setups. Which is why I think the idea of a [standardized query param](https://github.com/shane-moore/beacon-APIs/pull/2#discussion_r2727464736) to indicate whether the VC wants the full response or not would be good. 1-to-1 setups could then default to get the lightweight version of the response.

author: serenita_io
content:
I think the argument here is that there is simply a huge difference between exchanging

- post-Gloas BeaconBlock (40KB)
- post-Gloas BeaconBlock (40KB) + blobs (2.7MB for the current max 21 blobs) + ExecutionPayloadEnvelope (another few hundred KB)

The above stateless exchange means exchanging 3MB of data two ways -> 6MB of data. While this only takes about 50ms on a perfectly working 1Gbps link, it takes half a second (!) on a 100Mbps link. Say we slowly double the `MAX_BLOBS_PER_BLOCK`, then we're looking at 1 second of data exchange between the VC and BN.

That is quite a lot, to the point where I would no longer call it a micro-optimization.
